intro: Schismatoglottis parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered schismatoglottis, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its compact growth habit and clustered, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically white or pale green, arranged in dense inflorescences. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is cultivated by enthusiasts of rare and exotic plants.
